articles.headline: Fierce Quake Devastates Haitian Capital
articles.snippet: Officials warned that casualties could be substantial from the 7.0-magnitude earthquake, which left the Haitian capital in a shambles.
articles.abstract: Officials warned that casualties could be substantial from the 7.0-magnitude earthquake, which left the Haitian capital in a shambles.
articles.lead_paragraph: SANTO DOMINGO, Dominican Republic  A fierce earthquake struck Haiti late Tuesday afternoon, causing a crowded hospital to collapse, leveling countless shantytown dwellings and bringing even more suffering to a nation that was already the hemisphere’s poorest and most disaster-prone.
articles.byline: By Simon Romero and Marc Lacey

articles.headline: Google, Citing Attack, Threatens to Exit China
articles.snippet: The move, coming after assaults from hackers on its computer systems, would be a highly unusual rebuke of China by a large and respected company.
articles.abstract: The move, coming after assaults from hackers on its computer systems, would be a highly unusual rebuke of China by a large and respected company.
articles.lead_paragraph: This article was reported by Andrew Jacobs, Miguel Helft and John Markoff and written by Mr. Jacobs.
articles.byline: By Andrew Jacobs and Miguel Helft

articles.headline: Witness Is Revealed in Galleon Case
articles.snippet: Thomas Hardin, an investment analyst at the center of the biggest insider-trading case in a generation, may lead prosecutors to other key players in the investigation of Raj Rajaratnam and his Galleon Group hedge fund.
articles.abstract: Thomas Hardin, an investment analyst at the center of the biggest insider-trading case in a generation, may lead prosecutors to other key players in the investigation of Raj Rajaratnam and his Galleon Group hedge fund.
articles.lead_paragraph: It is one of the biggest mysteries on Wall Street: Who is Tipper X, the secret witness at the center of the biggest insider-trading case in a generation?

articles.headline: Lack of Medicare Chief Is a Strike Against Reform
articles.snippet: President Obama has not chosen anyone to lead Medicare, but the chief would oversee big parts of the health reform.
articles.abstract: President Obama has not chosen anyone to lead Medicare, but the chief would oversee big parts of the health reform.
articles.lead_paragraph: Almost a year after taking office, President Obama has not yet nominated anybody to run Medicare.

articles.headline: Hey Google, Anybody Home?
articles.snippet: Owners of the Nexus One, Google’s phone, have found themselves at a loss when it comes to seeking help with problems.
articles.abstract: Owners of the Nexus One, Google’s phone, have found themselves at a loss when it comes to seeking help with problems.
articles.lead_paragraph: Google’s celebrated algorithms may power the Web’s most popular search engine, but they have not yet been programmed to answer a call when a customer has a problem.
articles.byline: By Jenna Wortham and Miguel Helft

articles.headline: O’Brien Rejects NBC Shift: He’s Set to Say Good Night
articles.snippet: After NBC said it intended to move his “Tonight Show” to a new time, Conan O’Brien said he would not agree to what he saw as a demotion for the institution of the show.
articles.abstract: After NBC said it intended to move his “Tonight Show” to a new time, Conan O’Brien said he would not agree to what he saw as a demotion for the institution of the show.
articles.lead_paragraph: NBC may control its airwaves, but apparently it does not control Conan O’Brien.

articles.headline: A Year of Terror Plots, Through a Second Prism
articles.snippet: The enemies on American soil in 2009 were a scattered group of amateurs who displayed more fervor than skill.
articles.abstract: The enemies on American soil in 2009 were a scattered group of amateurs who displayed more fervor than skill.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  As terrorist plots against the United States have piled up in recent months, politicians and the news media have sounded the alarm with a riveting message for Americans: Be afraid. Al Qaeda is on the march again, targeting the country from within and without, and your hapless government cannot protect you.

articles.headline: Wall St. Pay Is a Focus of Many in Washington
articles.snippet: Tilting at Wall Street is a big game in Washington, one that will grow as federal hearings into the causes of the financial crisis begin on Wednesday.
articles.abstract: Tilting at Wall Street is a big game in Washington, one that will grow as federal hearings into the causes of the financial crisis begin on Wednesday.
articles.lead_paragraph: Everyone in Washington is taking a swing at Wall Street pay.

articles.headline: For Bankers, Saying ‘Sorry’ Has Its Perils
articles.snippet: The art of admitting mistakes without accepting blame will be on display at a Congressional hearing Wednesday.
articles.abstract: The art of admitting mistakes without accepting blame will be on display at a Congressional hearing Wednesday.
articles.lead_paragraph: As America recovers from the worst financial crisis since the Depression, some of the nation’s chief executives are offering that rarest of statements  an apology.
articles.byline: By Andrew Martin and Micheline Maynard

articles.headline:
At Goldman, E-Mail Message
Lays Bare Conflicts in Trading
articles.snippet: An executive told a group of select clients that the firm sometimes used investment strategies before clients got them. A spokesman noted this has always been disclosed.
articles.abstract: An executive told a group of select clients that the firm sometimes used investment strategies before clients got them. A spokesman noted this has always been disclosed.
articles.lead_paragraph: For years, Wall Street whispered that Goldman Sachs profited handsomely by trading ahead of  or even against  its own clients.

articles.headline: Deals to Restrain Generic Drugs Face a Ban
articles.snippet: A group of House lawmakers plans to ask Congress to block deals in which they say makers of name-brand drugs directly or indirectly pay generic makers to delay competition from cheaper generic alternatives.
articles.abstract: A group of House lawmakers plans to ask Congress to block deals in which they say makers of name-brand drugs directly or indirectly pay generic makers to delay competition from cheaper generic alternatives.
articles.lead_paragraph: A group of House lawmakers and the head of the Federal Trade Commission want Congress to include a provision in the health care legislation that they say could save American consumers several billion dollars a year on prescription drugs.

articles.headline: Haiti Lies in Ruins; Grim Search for Untold Dead
articles.snippet: Huge swaths of Port-au-Prince lay in ruins, and thousands of people were feared dead in the rubble.
articles.abstract: Huge swaths of Port-au-Prince lay in ruins, and thousands of people were feared dead in the rubble.
articles.lead_paragraph: PORT-AU-PRINCE, Haiti — Survivors strained desperately on Wednesday against the chunks of concrete that buried this city along with thousands of its residents, rich and poor, from shantytowns to the presidential palace, in the devastating earthquake that struck late Tuesday afternoon.
